basics.name: Juk-Sen Tang
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher in Agricultural Economics
basics.summary: Undergraduate student at McGill University with research interests in agricultural economics, environmental economics, and applied econometrics. Currently working on carbon pricing policy impacts and agricultural productivity analysis.

work.name: Key Lab of Urban Agriculture (North China), Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, Beijing Academy of Agricultural and Forestry Sciences
work.summary: Contributing to research on agricultural productivity and policy analysis for North China urban agriculture.
highlights: Drafted policy briefs for the PRC 15th Five-Year Agricultural Plan and benchmarked Canada's agri-innovation model to inform national strategy
Built spatial econometric datasets and dashboards supporting urban agriculture decision-making across North China municipalities
Agricultural productivity analysis and policy evaluation

work.name: International Education College, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics
highlights: Coordinate bilingual outreach, interview logistics, and enrollment reporting for international student recruitment

education.institution: Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics

publications.name: Agricultural Productivity and its Spatial Spillover Effects in China
publications.summary: Authors: TANG Juk-Sen (Lead), LU Hongwei, GONG Tianyi, CHEN Junhong. Built an IV-LP-ACF-SAR framework to quantify provincial total factor productivity trajectories and spatial spillovers across China's 31 provinces (2014-2023).

publications.name: Carbon Price Certainty and Green Innovation: Evidence from Canada's Federal Backstop Policy
publications.summary: This study examines how carbon pricing policy certainty affects green innovation in Canada. Using data from Canada's Federal Backstop Policy implementation, we analyze the impact of policy certainty on firms' green technology investment and patent activities.

awards.title: Innovation Capability Enhancement Program
awards.awarder: Beijing Academy of Agricultural and Forestry Sciences
awards.summary: Research grant supporting agricultural innovation studies

awards.title: Think Tank Cultivation Base Program
awards.awarder: Beijing Association for Science and Technology
awards.summary: Research grant for policy analysis and think tank development

references.name: Dr. Junhong Chen (陈俊红)
references.reference: Researcher at Beijing Academy of Agricultural and Forestry Sciences. Registered Consulting Engineer (Investment), Master's Supervisor. Research focus on urban modern agriculture and innovation in science & technology systems. Led over 30 research projects including Beijing Social Science Fund and municipal soft science projects. Published over 50 papers in core journals and authored 5 monographs. Email: chenjunhong@baafs.net.cn
